H0.text: A ruler and a protractor are the pieces of equipment used to measure the density of a solution.

H1.text: A magnet and a thermometer are pieces of equipment used to measure the density of a solution.

H2.text: A graduated cylinder and a balance are the pieces of equipment used to measure the density of a solution.

H3.text: An Erlenmeyer flask and a Bunsen burner are pieces of equipment used to measure the density of a solution.

A4.text: Graduated cylinders are often used to measure the volume of a liquid.

A5.text: Graduated cylinders are generally more accurate and precise than laboratory flasks and beakers.
